verb.description: To overcome, exhaust, or harass with labour; to overwork; to overburden. Also refl. Now rare.
To labour excessively at, take too many pains with; to elaborate to excess.

origin: Late 16th century (in an earlier sense). From over-labour<br>mid 16th century; earliest use found in John Palsgrave (d. 1554), teacher and scholar of languages. From over- + labour.
